name: Idiopathic Segmental Arterial Mediolysis
chief_complaint: Sudden, severe abdominal pain with episodes of dizziness
treatment: surgical resection of affected arterial segments
prognosis: Guarded - high risk of recurrent arterial dissections or ruptures without intervention
description: A rare non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory arteriopathy characterized by vacuolization and lysis of arterial medial smooth muscle cells, leading to segmental arterial weakness, dissection, and rupture. Most commonly affects visceral arteries in middle-aged patients without traditional vascular risk factors.
